headline: Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel wants to use AI to make it “easier for everybody to experience the world”
summary: "We should be able to handle everything for you, so that from start to finish, from beginning to plan it out till the time you actually book," Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel told Fortune.

raw.headline: Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel wants to use AI to make it “easier for everybody to experience the world”
raw.summary: "We should be able to handle everything for you, so that from start to finish, from beginning to plan it out till the time you actually book," Booking Holdings CEO Glenn Fogel told Fortune.

headline: Sustainability Top of Mind for Majority of Thai Travelers - Agoda Survey Reveals
summary: Digital travel platform Agoda's 2025 Sustainable Travel Survey reveals more than 3 out of 4 Thai travelers (76.97%) consider sustainability when making their travel plans for 2025, higher than the average for all Asian travelers combined (68%)

raw.headline: Sustainability Top of Mind for Majority of Thai Travelers - Agoda Survey Reveals
raw.summary: Digital travel platform Agoda's 2025 Sustainable Travel Survey reveals more than 3 out of 4 Thai travelers (76.97%) consider sustainability when making their travel plans for 2025, higher than the average for all Asian travelers combined (68%)

headline: Sustainability Top of Mind for Malaysian Travelers in 2025 - Agoda Survey Reveals
summary: Digital travel platform Agoda's 2025 Sustainable Travel Survey reveals Malaysia as the fourth most sustainability-conscious travel market in Asia, with nearly four in five Malaysian travelers (80%) factoring sustainability into their 2025 travel plans, higher than the average for all Asian travelers combined (68%).

raw.headline: Sustainability Top of Mind for Malaysian Travelers in 2025 - Agoda Survey Reveals

headline: Sustainability Top of Mind for Majority of South Korean Travelers - Agoda Survey Reveals
summary: Digital travel platform Agoda's 2025 Sustainable Travel Survey reveals that nearly three out of every four South Korean travelers (73%) consider sustainability when making their travel plans for 2025, higher than the average for all Asian travelers combined (68%).
